author: Gautam S Mengle
text:
The Mumbai Police have started inquiries into an offensive tweet to Pakistani journalist Mehr Tarar.

On Sunday, Ms Tarar tagged a leading Indian journalist in a tweet over linking rape cases to the religion of the perpetrators. Soon, a user by the name of Ganesh Aiyer sent an offensive tweet to her. Within an hour, another user, Rohan Kadam, reported the tweet to the official handle of the Mumbai Police, tagging Ms Tarar, who herself responded saying Aiyer had deleted the tweet but she had saved a screenshot, which she posted on the police’s Twitter handle.

The police responded saying her complaint had been forwarded to the authorities concerned.

“The cyber police station has been instructed to look into the matter,” said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Detection) Dhananjay Kulkarni.

Ms Tarar later tweeted a message of thanks to the police. Aiyer attracted a slew of critical reactions over his tweets.
title: Pakistani scribe gets offensive tweet, police start probe
